title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to iucnr
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to iucnr
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to iucnr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("PaulESantos/iucnr", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to iucnr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to iucnr
text: Please note iucnr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
title: IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
text: dataset contains taxonomic information IUCN Red List Threatened Species, downloaded GBIF website. includes taxonomic details conservation status, species across multiple kingdoms, providing comprehensive view species included Red List.

title: IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
text: tibble 150,490 rows 12 variables: search_name character. search-friendly version scientific name. scientific_name character. full scientific name taxon, including authorship. family character. taxonomic family taxon belongs. genus character. genus taxon. specific_epithet character. specific epithet taxon, forming species name together genus. infraspecific_epithet character. epithet infraspecific taxa, subspecies varieties, applicable. infrasp_tag character. Indicator rank infraspecific taxa (e.g., subspecies, variety, forma). taxon_rank character. taxonomic rank taxon (e.g., species, subspecies, variety). taxonomic_status character. taxon's status, indicating whether accepted synonym. accepted_name_usage_id integer. Identifier accepted name synonyms, core ID accepted names. core_id character. unique identifier linking taxon data distribution data. threat_status character. IUCN conservation status species, "Endangered", "Vulnerable", "Least Concern". data sourced two files: taxon.txt: Provides taxonomic information including scientific names, taxon ranks, accepted name usage IDs. distribution.txt: Contains information IUCN threat status taxon.

title: IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
text: IUCN Red List Threatened Species, available GBIF: https://www.gbif.org/dataset/19491596-35ae-4a91-9a98-85cf505f1bd3

title: IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
code: # Load the data data(iucn_data)  # View the first few rows of the dataset head(iucn_data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 12 #>   search_name              scientific_name         family genus specific_epithet #>   <chr>                    <chr>                   <chr>  <chr> <chr>            #> 1 Calocedrus rupestris     Calocedrus rupestris A… CUPRE… Calo… rupestris        #> 2 Narthecium reverchonii   Narthecium reverchonii… NARTH… Nart… reverchonii      #> 3 Asparagus humilis        Asparagus humilis Engl. ASPAR… Aspa… humilis          #> 4 Bulbostylis boeckleriana Bulbostylis boeckleria… CYPER… Bulb… boeckleriana     #> 5 Bulbostylis hispidula    Bulbostylis hispidula … CYPER… Bulb… hispidula        #> 6 Ophrys melitensis        Ophrys melitensis (Sal… ORCHI… Ophr… melitensis       #> # ℹ 7 more variables: infraspecific_epithet <chr>, infrasp_tag <chr>, #> #   taxon_rank <chr>, taxonomic_status <chr>, accepted_name_usage_id <int>, #> #   core_id <chr>, threat_status <chr>

what: IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
title: IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
text: dataset contains vernacular (common) names species included IUCN Red List Threatened Species. vernacular names provided various languages, species, multiple common names exist. vernacular name linked taxon core dataset unique identifier.

title: IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
text: tibble 156,417 rows 4 variables: core_id integer. unique identifier linking vernacular name corresponding taxon core dataset. language character. language vernacular name provided, using standard language codes (e.g., "fra" French, "eng" English). vernacular_name character. common vernacular name species specified language. is_preferred_name logical. Indicates whether vernacular name preferred name (TRUE) alternative name (FALSE). dataset provides essential information understanding common names species different languages, can useful local conservation efforts public communication species.

title: IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
text: IUCN Red List Threatened Species, available GBIF: https://www.gbif.org/dataset/19491596-35ae-4a91-9a98-85cf505f1bd3

title: IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
code: # Load the data data(vernacular_name)  # View the first few rows of the dataset head(vernacular_name) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   core_id language vernacular_name        is_preferred_name #>     <int> <chr>    <chr>                  <lgl>             #> 1  157938 FRA      Narthécie de Reverchon TRUE              #> 2  157938 FRA      Ossifrage de Reverchon FALSE             #> 3  162229 MLT      Brimba Sewda           FALSE             #> 4  162229 ENG      Maltse Spider Orchid   TRUE              #> 5  163990 FRA      Héléocharis des Marais FALSE             #> 6  163990 ENG      Common Spike-rush      TRUE
